member.name: M:AForge.GestureRecognition.Gesture.#ctor(AForge.GestureRecognition.HandPosition,AForge.GestureRecognition.HandPosition)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the structure.

member.name: T:AForge.GestureRecognition.GestureDetectionEventHandler
member.summary: Delegate to notify about detected and recognized gesture.

remarks.para: The class processes video feed recognizing gestures of human's bodies. The processing algorithm first of all tries to locate big object, which is presumably human body. When the object is not moving for a while, the algorithms tries to recognize its gesture. In the case of successfull recognition, the class fires an event.
Sample usage:

member.name: M:AForge.GestureRecognition.GesturesRecognizerFromVideo.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:AForge.GestureRecognition.GesturesRecognizerFromVideo.Reset
member.summary: Reset gesture recognition engine to initial state.
member.remarks: The method resets the engine to initial state, resetting all internal variable to the same state like after class instantiation.

member.name: M:AForge.GestureRecognition.GesturesRecognizerFromVideo.ProcessFrame(System.Drawing.Bitmap@)
member.remarks: Process new frame of video source and try to recognize gesture.

member.name: P:AForge.GestureRecognition.GesturesRecognizerFromVideo.GestureRecognizer
member.remarks: The property allows to access instance and alter its properties.

remarks.para: The property sets minimum object's width, which is treated as human body. All objects with width less then this value are not treated as human body and are not passed to gesture recognition algorithm.
Default value is set to 50.

The property sets minimum object's height, which is treated as human body. All objects with height less then this value are not treated as human body and are not passed to gesture recognition algorithm.
Default value is set to 50.

member.name: P:AForge.GestureRecognition.GesturesRecognizerFromVideo.MotionLimit
member.summary: Motion limit, which is used to avoid gesture detection of moving object.

remarks.para: Once a big moving object is detect (presumably human body), gesture recognition algorithm may try to recognize its gesture. To avoid gesture recognition of moving object, the video processing module waits certain amount of frames without motion (). When object is not moving for a while, gesture recognition algorithm tries to recognize the gesture.

The property sets limit of changed pixels to detect motion. If number of changed pixels between two continuous frames is greater than this value, then object is supposed to be moving. Otherwise object is not moving and gesture recognition may occur.
Minimal possible value is 0. Maximal possible value is 1. Default value is set 0.005 (0.5%).

member.name: P:AForge.GestureRecognition.GesturesRecognizerFromVideo.MinFramesWithoutMotion
member.summary: Minimual amount of frames without motion before passing current frame to gesture recognition.

remarks.para: The property sets the amount of frames, which should pass without motion detection, before gesture recognition algorithm starts to recognize gesture on a current frame.
Default value is set to 3.

member.name: P:AForge.GestureRecognition.GesturesRecognizerFromVideo.MinFramesWithoutGestureChange
member.summary: Minimal amount of frames without gesture changes before signaling about recognized gesture.

remarks.para: The property is required to avoid false gesture recognitions. If the same gesture is recognized during specified amount of continues frames, then it is supposed to be recognized correctly.
Default value is set to 1.

para.note: If the property is set to 0, then it means that first recognized gesture is treated as valid - further frames are not checked.

member.name: E:AForge.GestureRecognition.GesturesRecognizerFromVideo.GestureDetected
member.summary: Event to notify about detected and recognized gesture.

remarks.para: The class processes specified image of human's body, trying to recognize hands' gesture.

para.note: The class processes only binary (8 bpp indexed) images, where white color is represented by 255 value (black is 0).

remarks.para: Sample usage:

member.name: M:AForge.GestureRecognition.GestureRecognizer.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:AForge.GestureRecognition.GestureRecognizer.Recognize(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Boolean)
member.param: Source image to recognize hands gesture on.
Specifies if the passed image data contain only human's body or not.
member.returns: Returns gesture structure, which specifies position of both hands.

remarks.para: The bodyImageOnly> parameter specifies if human's body occupies the passes image from top to down and from left to rigth. If the value is set to false, then humans' body may occupy only part of the image, what will require image shrinking.

member.name: M:AForge.GestureRecognition.GestureRecognizer.Recognize(System.Drawing.Imaging.BitmapData,System.Boolean)
member.param: Source image data to recognize hands gesture on.
Specifies if the passed image data contain only human's body or not.
member.returns: Returns gesture structure, which specifies position of both hands.

remarks.para: The bodyImageOnly> parameter specifies if human's body occupies the passes image from top to down and from left to rigth. If the value is set to false, then humans' body may occupy only part of the image, what will require image shrinking.

member.name: M:AForge.GestureRecognition.GestureRecognizer.GetHandPosition(System.Drawing.Bitmap)
member.summary: Estimate hand position on the specified image.

member.name: M:AForge.GestureRecognition.GestureRecognizer.FilterNoisyPeaks(AForge.Math.Histogram)
member.summary: Remove peaks from the histogram, which don't contain maximum value.

remarks.para: The coefficient is used to find hands and torso on the initial image. Horizontal image histogram is scanned and all areas, where proportion of object's height to image height is greater then the this coefficient, are treated as torso are.
Minimal possible value is 0. Maximal possible value is 1. Default value is set to 0.3.
The value sets minimal proportion of hand to torso width. If hand on the processing image has proportion, which is less then this value, then this hand is treated as not raised.
Minimal possible value is 0. Default value is set to 0.3.

The value sets minimal proportion of straight hand's width to its height. If hand on a processing image has proportion greater then this value, then the hand is treated as straight. Otherwise it is treated as diagonal.
Minimal possible value is 0. Default value is set to 1.3.

The value sets maximal proportion of free space above raised hand on the image to hand's height. If proportion of free space above raised hand on the image is less than this value, then the hand is supposed to be raised diagonally up. Otherwise it is supposed to be raised diagonally down.
Minimal possible value is 0. Default value is set to 0.35.
